alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued August 16 at 3:37PM MST until August 16 at 4:30PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Northeastern Yuma County in southwestern Arizona... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... * Until 430 PM MST. * At 337 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Sentinel to 12 miles west of Gila Bend Auxiliary Field to near Gila Bend, moving northwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 76 and 124. AZ Route 238 between mile markers 1 and 5. AZ Route 85 between mile markers 1 and 12, and between mile markers 119 and 135. Locations impacted include... Gila Bend, Gila Bend Auxiliary Field, Cotton Center, Sentinel, Paloma and Hyder. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE! Strong to severe thunderstorms are also possible behind this wall of dust. Keep updated with this quickly evolving situation.
